intro: Psychotria tapajozensis, commonly known as the Tapajoz psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. This species is of interest to botanists and researchers due to its potential chemical compounds and ecological significance in its native habitat.
